Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a fish in its natural water habitat, such as a lake, river, pond, or ocean.
The student can label the parts of the drawing, including the fish and the water.
The student can show where the fish gets what it needs to live, like water for swimming and breathing.
The student can include and label other plants or animals that might live in the same habitat as the fish.
The student can show how the fish and other living things use the resources in their habitat to survive.
The student can illustrate and describe how the parts of the system (fish, other animals, plants, water) work together and depend on each other.
